sentence: Analysts at Argus Research are still positive on shares of Berkshire Hathaway ( BRK.B ) but have concerns about the company's succession plans, the said in a report on Tuesday.

Researchers Stephen Biggar and Mike Jaffe put a hold rating on Berkshire's B shares as they intiated coverage, saying they expect "solid" 10% earnings growth in 2017, up from an estimated 5% last year, as improved economics help its manufacturing, insurance and energy holdings.

"We have a positive view of Berkshire, whose stock returns have more than doubled those of the S&P 500

since 1965," the researchers said.
The company has grown over the decades through acquisitions ranging from $5 billion to $20 billion, recenlty acquiring Duracell Batteries from Procter & Gamble ( PG ).
Management is aligned well with shareholders as insiders still own just over 40% of outstanding shares, Argus said.

Argus said its financial strenght rating on Berkshire is high as it had cash and investments of $228 billion and posted an operating margin of 16.3% in the year through September, above the 13.6% average for its peers.
Still, the projected earnings growth of 10% is below the broader market, Argus said.
Biggar and Jaffe said they are concerned about the company succession plan.
Chief Executive Warren Buffett, 86, and Vice Chairman Charlie Munger, 93, have been "critical" to the company's success and will be difficult to replace, Argus said.

"Although Mr. Buffet has recommended possible successors to the Berkshire board, his recommendations have not been made public and there is no way of knowing how successful any new CEO will be in his place," Argus said in the note.

"Other risks facing Berkshire include a likely significant reduction in coal volume at Burlington Northern Santa Fe in the coming years; the continued loss of subscribers at the company's newspapers; and the impact of e-commerce on the company's retail holdings and some of its consumer brands."
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
